title: Presentations
section: Wellbore failure occurs because the stress around the well exceeds the strength of the rock.
text:
Wellbore failure occurs because the stress around the well exceeds the strength of the rock.

title: Presentations
section: Faults will slip when the ratio of shear to normal stress on the fault exceeds its frictional strength.
text:
Faults will slip when the ratio of shear to normal stress on the fault exceeds its frictional strength.

© USGS Image Source

title: Presentations
section: Reservior depletion causes changes in the stress state at depth that can be beneficial, or detrimental, to production.
text:
Reservior depletion causes changes in the stress state at depth that can be beneficial, or detrimental, to production.

© IESL Image Source
Image is of a simulation that is used to identify changes in porosity and/or permeability due to pore pressure depletion.



USNCCM 17 – July 2023
